TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CacheItem extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Represents an individual cache entry in the cache.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> class provides a logical representation of a cache entry, which can include regions by using the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.RegionName%2A> property. In the default ASP.NET cache implementation, a cache entry is a key/value pair.
Entries in the cache are not <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> instances. Instead, the cache provider can store cache entries in any internal format that is convenient. However, the cache API requires cache providers to be able to convert cache entries into <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> instances (and vice versa).
Custom cache implementations can inherit from the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> class provide additional information about cache entries.
## Examples The following example shows how to use the <xref:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem> class to store the contents of a file as a cache entry.
[!code-csharp[System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.runtime.caching.cacheitem/cs/default.aspx.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/system.runtime.caching.cacheitem/vb/default.aspx.vb#1)]

block.para: The class has methods that support adding, fetching, and updating cache data, and all these methods have overloads that support the class. Therefore, a custom cache implementation can create an extended class and use that extended class together with the existing API for cache entries.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
